questions.question: A rectangle has a length of 38 cm and a width of 24 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Area of rectangle = length × width = 38 × 24 = 912 cm²

questions.question: The perimeter of a square is 88 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Side length = perimeter ÷ 4 = 88 ÷ 4 = 22 cm. Area = side² = 22 × 22 = 484 cm²

questions.question: A circle has a diameter of 28 cm. What is its area? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Radius = diameter ÷ 2 = 28 ÷ 2 = 14 cm. Area = πr² = (22/7) × 14 × 14 = 616 cm²

questions.question: The area of a regular hexagon is 216√3 square centimeters. What is the length of each side?
questions.explanation: Area of regular hexagon = (3√3/2) × side². Therefore, side² = (2 × 216√3) ÷ (3√3) = 144. Therefore, side = √144 = 12 cm

questions.question: A triangle has a base of 36 cm and a height of 18 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Area of triangle = (1/2) × base × height = (1/2) × 36 × 18 = 324 cm²

questions.question: The area of a rectangle is 520 square meters and its width is 26 meters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Length = area ÷ width = 520 ÷ 26 = 20 meters. Perimeter = 2(length + width) = 2(20 + 26) = 92 meters

questions.question: A circle has a radius of 21 cm. What is its circumference? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 2 × (22/7) × 21 = 132 cm

questions.question: The area of a parallelogram is 270 square centimeters and its base is 30 centimeters. What is its height?
questions.explanation: Height = area ÷ base = 270 ÷ 30 = 9 cm

questions.question: A square and a rectangle have the same area. The rectangle has length 48 cm and width 27 cm. What is the perimeter of the square?
questions.explanation: Area of rectangle = 48 × 27 = 1296 cm². Side of square = √1296 = 36 cm. Perimeter of square = 4 × 36 = 144 cm

questions.question: The area of a trapezium is 420 square meters. Its parallel sides are 35 meters and 85 meters. What is its height?
questions.explanation: Area of trapezium = (1/2)(sum of parallel sides) × height. Therefore, height = (2 × area) ÷ (sum of parallel sides) = (2 × 420) ÷ (35 + 85) = 840 ÷ 120 = 7 meters

questions.question: A regular pentagon has a side length of 16 cm. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: In a regular pentagon, all sides are equal. Perimeter = 5 × side length = 5 × 16 = 80 cm

questions.question: The area of a circle is 616 square centimeters. What is its radius? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Area = πr² = 616. Therefore, r² = 616 ÷ (22/7) = 196. Therefore, r = √196 = 14 cm

questions.question: A rectangle has a perimeter of 76 cm and a length of 24 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Perimeter = 2(length + width). Therefore, width = (76 ÷ 2) - 24 = 14 cm. Area = length × width = 24 × 14 = 336 cm²

questions.question: The area of a rhombus is 270 square centimeters and one of its diagonals is 45 centimeters. What is the length of the other diagonal?
questions.explanation: Area of rhombus = (1/2) × product of diagonals. Therefore, other diagonal = (2 × area) ÷ given diagonal = (2 × 270) ÷ 45 = 12 cm

questions.question: A circle has a circumference of 132 cm. What is its area? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 132. Therefore, r = 132 ÷ (2 × 22/7) = 21 cm. Area = πr² = (22/7) × 21 × 21 = 1386 cm²

questions.question: The perimeter of a rectangle is 68 cm and its area is 288 square centimeters. What are its dimensions?
questions.explanation: Let length = l and width = w. Then 2(l + w) = 68 and l × w = 288. Solving these equations gives l = 18 cm and w = 16 cm

questions.question: A regular octagon has a side length of 12 cm. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: In a regular octagon, all sides are equal. Perimeter = 8 × side length = 8 × 12 = 96 cm

questions.question: The area of a triangle is 180 square centimeters and its height is 24 centimeters. What is its base?
questions.explanation: Area of triangle = (1/2) × base × height. Therefore, base = (2 × area) ÷ height = (2 × 180) ÷ 24 = 15 cm

questions.question: A square and a rectangle have the same perimeter. The rectangle has length 40 cm and width 28 cm. What is the area of the square?
questions.explanation: Perimeter of rectangle = 2(40 + 28) = 136 cm. Side of square = 136 ÷ 4 = 34 cm. Area of square = 34 × 34 = 1156 cm²

questions.question: The area of a circle is 1256 square centimeters. What is its diameter? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Area = πr² = 1256. Therefore, r² = 1256 ÷ 3.14 = 400. Therefore, r = √400 = 20 cm. Diameter = 2 × r = 2 × 20 = 40 cm

questions.question: A parallelogram has a base of 32 cm and a height of 18 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Area of parallelogram = base × height = 32 × 18 = 576 cm²

questions.question: The circumference of a circle is 157 cm. What is its area? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 157. Therefore, r = 157 ÷ (2 × 3.14) = 25 cm. Area = πr² = 3.14 × 25 × 25 = 1962 cm²

questions.question: A rectangle has a length of 36 cm and an area of 432 square centimeters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Width = area ÷ length = 432 ÷ 36 = 12 cm. Perimeter = 2(length + width) = 2(36 + 12) = 96 cm

questions.question: The perimeter of a square is 84 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Side length = perimeter ÷ 4 = 84 ÷ 4 = 21 cm. Area = side² = 21 × 21 = 441 cm²

questions.question: A triangle has sides of length 28 cm, 96 cm, and 100 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: This is a right-angled triangle (28-96-100). Area = (1/2) × base × height = (1/2) × 28 × 96 = 1344 cm²

questions.question: The area of a rectangle is 480 square meters and its width is 24 meters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Length = area ÷ width = 480 ÷ 24 = 20 meters. Perimeter = 2(length + width) = 2(20 + 24) = 88 meters

questions.question: A circle has a radius of 25 cm. What is its circumference? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 2 × 3.14 × 25 = 157 cm

questions.question: The area of a trapezium is 480 square centimeters. Its parallel sides are 60 centimeters and 80 centimeters. What is its height?
questions.explanation: Area of trapezium = (1/2)(sum of parallel sides) × height. Therefore, height = (2 × area) ÷ (sum of parallel sides) = (2 × 480) ÷ (60 + 80) = 960 ÷ 140 = 7 cm

questions.question: A square has an area of 841 square centimeters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Side length = √841 = 29 cm. Perimeter = 4 × side = 4 × 29 = 116 cm

questions.question: The circumference of a circle is 188.4 cm. What is its radius? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 188.4. Therefore, r = 188.4 ÷ (2 × 3.14) = 30 cm
